La socia es la Sra: Gladis, la socia tiene 34 años de edad;  la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14, 2 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la elaboración de jora, ella nos comenta que entierras el maíz amarillo remojado con paja y después de un día la socia ya procesa la jora mediante un proceso de fermentación natural, la socia suele comprar maíz amarillo para la realización de la jora que después es vendida, la socia requiere el crédito para comprar al por mayor maíz amarillo. La socia solicita el préstamo el cual le servirá para comprar al por mayor el maíz amarillo para elaborar la jora para la venta.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y elaborar sus platillos para la venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named "Sumac Tika-Valle Sagrado". It is located in the community of Qotohuycho, belonging to the Province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Here we meet Gladis. She is 34 years old and she is married common-law. She has 3 children, aged 16, 14, and 2 years old. She alternates her daily household activities with her jora drinks business. She says that she buries the yellow corn and potatoes in water and after one day she processes the jora through natural fermentation.  She plans on purchasing yellow corn to make jora for later sale. She requires this loan to purchase yellow corn in wholesale.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare recipes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase yellow corn in wholesale.

loans.name: Diana Oliva

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana R. es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive en la comunidad de Zhidmad  donde se puede disfrutar de hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población sale diariamente a laborar en la ciudad y muchos también han migrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

La Señora. Diana tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad que  estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es un maestro en la rama de la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus padres con quienes comparten los gastos del hogar.

Doña Diana tiene en un bazar en el que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Esta actividad le da tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos y familia.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana R. is a member of the communal bank “14 de Agosto” (August 14th).  She lives in the Zhidmad community where one can enjoy the beautiful countryside where the people work raising animals and in agriculture.  Much of the population goes daily to the city to work and many have also left to look for a better future for their families. 

Diana is 29-years-old and is married with two children who are nine and six-years-old and who study in a little school in their area.  Her husband works in construction.  They do not have their own house because they live in his parent’s house with whom they share the expenses of the house.

Diana has a stationery shop where she works Sunday to Sunday from seven in the morning to eight at night.  This gives her time to care for her children and family.

She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and her new loan will be invested in items for the stationery shop.  

Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy items for a stationery shop.

loans.name: Tututepec Los Maguitos Group

texts.es:
“Tututepec los Manguitos” este grupo se llama así porque existen varios árboles de mangos donde es el punto de reunión de los integrantes y también porque todos pertenecen a la población de Tututepec “Cerro del pájaro”, un lugar muy hermoso con mucha diversidad de flora y fauna. Este grupo esta formado por 11 personas muy trabajadoras que se dedican a diferentes actividades para obtener dinero y así mantener a su familia y son las siguientes: Erud (Herreria-compra de materiales para la elaboración de puertas y ventanas), Zarai, Reyna y Yesica (Venta de cosméticos y Tupper Ware), Lourdes (Venta de pescados), Carlos (Servcio de Taxi), Minerva y Gloria (Venta de antojitos), Maribel y Balbina (Venta de tamales y pozole), Antonio (Cultivo de limón).            
Minerva es una mujer que a sabido enfrentar la vida y luchar para salir adelante, ella a trabajado duro cada día para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que desde hace varios años se divorcio de su esposo y desde entonces inicio con el negocio de antojitos; actividad que le ah ayudado a mantener a sus hijos y darles educación, tiene 3 hijos los cuales 2 trabajan y la ayudan con los gastos económicos solo tiene a 1 estudiando por el cual se esfuerza mas para darle una carrera y tenga mejores oportunidades el día de mañana, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la población en el cual vende antojitos como son: sopes, tostadas, enchiladas y quesadillas, ella solicito el crédito para comprar mas productos para la elaboración de sus antojitos como son: tomate, chiles, cebollas, queso, pollo, carne de res, entre otros ya que son sus ingredientes principales. 
Ella comenta que actualmente le va bien en su negocio, tiene varios clientes ya que la mayoría de la población la conoce por lo rico que guisa, además de que el lugar donde vende es muy transitable. Su desafío que enfrenta es la competencia ya que hay varios puestos de comida en ese lugar pero ella casi no se preocupa ya que ella dice “que Dios le da para todos” y que “para todos sale el sol”, ella le agradece a Dios porque nunca le ha hecho falta alimentación y siempre le ha dado la fuerza para salir adelante con todo.
Minerva comenta que su mas grande sueño es remodelar su casa es por ello que de las ganancias que obtiene esta haciendo unos ahorritos para iniciar con su sueño.
Todos lo integrantes de este grupo agradecen por el préstamo otorgado ya que gracias a ello podrán invertir más en su negocio y así obtener más ganancias para solventar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Tututepec los Manguitos” because there are several mango trees at the place where the group meets and because they all belong to the town of Tututepec “Hill of the Bird,” a very beautiful place with much variety of flora and fauna. 

The group has 11 very hard working members who are in a variety of different activities:  Erud (metal shop; purchases materials to make doors and windows), Zaray, Reyna and Yesica (Tupperware and cosmetics sales), Lourdes (fish sales), Carlos (taxi services), Minerva and Gloria (fast food sales), Maribel and Balbina (tamale and pozole sales) and Antonio (lemon farmer).

Minerva is a woman who has known how to face life and fight to get ahead.  She’s worked hard every day to support her children because for many years now since her divorce from her husband she’s been in the fast food business, an activity that has helped her support her children and provide them with education.  She has three children.  Two of them work and help her with household expenses and she still has one in school.  She works hard to provide a career for him so that he will have better opportunities in the future.

She has a small business located downtown where she sells fast food like: sopes, tostadas, enchiladas and quesadillas.  She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make the dishes like: tomatoes, chilies, onion, cheese, chicken and beef, among others, since these are the main ingredients.

She comments that she’s doing well in the business currently.  She has several customers since most of the population knows that her dishes are very tasty.  Besides, the place she’s located at has a lot of foot traffic.  The challenge she faces is competition because there are several food stands nearby but she isn’t concerned about that because she says: “God provides for everyone” and “the sun rises for all.”  She thanks God because she’s never lacked food and He has always given her strength to get ahead.

Minerva comments that her greatest wish is to remodel her house and this is why she’s saving up a little from her profits to start making this dream come true.

All the group members are grateful for the loan provided because, thanks to it, they will be able to invest more in their businesses and obtain higher profits to meet their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fast food ingredients and to buy cosmetics.

location.town: Villa de Melchor Ocampo, Tututepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando P. tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos a su cuidado. Él vive en la zona de Cerro Verde de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la casa de sus queridos padres. Fernando es una persona que proviene de una familia humilde. El trabajo desde muy joven para que algún día pudiera comprarse un vehículo propio.

Fernando trabaja como como chofer de taxi todos los días y fue hasta ahora que ha logrado ahorrar un monto de dinero para que pueda comprarse un vehículo propio y así mejore su nivel de vida mejorando sus ingresos.
Por ello Fernando necesita el préstamo para que compre un vehículo ya que el dinero que tiene no le fue suficiente. Él está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de contar con una herramienta de trabajo propia.

Fernando entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que compre un mejor vehículo y así brinde un mejor servicio a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Fernando P. is 27 years old, single and does not have any children yet in his care.  He lives in Cochabamba’s Cerro Verde zone in his beloved parents’ house.  Fernando comes from a humble family.  He’s worked since a very young age so that he could buy his own vehicle.

Fernando works every day as a Taxi Driver and has managed to save up an amount of money to buy a car of his own to improve his standard of living earning higher income.

But Fernando needs a loan to buy the car because what he has saved up isn’t quite enough.  He is very grateful to the people who through Kiva will give him the opportunity to have a work tool of his own.

Among Fernando’s future plans is taking out another loan to buy a better car in order to provide still better service to society.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 36 años de edad, ella es casada con dos hijos menores de  directa, Victoria reside en  vive en casa propia.  La zona rural de Carachuco a 25 minutos del distrito de Mórrope,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 300  familias.

Victoria se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era más joven y por otro lado, como actividad principal se dedica a la cría animales, especialmente aves, ovejas y chanchos en algunos corrales situados en su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Victoria se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 16 años, en los que adquirido clientela fija y mucha más experiencia en el rubro.

Victoria desea invertir en  la compra de alimento balanceado para chanchos y aves, adicionalmente la construcción de corrales mas seguros para el resguardo de su ganado menor.  Victoria esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo  de s/. 3000 para que de esta manera, ella pueda cubrir todos sus gastos.

Victoria es una mujer conocida por su entusiasmo,  por su responsabilidad y sobre todo por la dedicación en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 36, is married and has two minor children.  Victoria lives in her own house in the rural zone of Carachuco.  It is 25 minutes from the Mórrope district, and it has basic services like water and electricity.  It is a small community with approximately 300 families.

Victoria has been doing agricultural work since she was very young.  Her main activity is raising animals, especially birds, sheep, and pigs in some corrals at her house.  She feeds them grains and natural fodder.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the businessmen who frequently visit the zone where she lives.  Victoria has been doing this for over 16 years.  During that time she has acquired fixed customers and a lot more experience in this field.

Victoria wishes to buy balanced feed for pigs and birds.  She also wants to build more secure corrals in order to safeguard her small livestock.  Victoria is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This way she will be able to cover all of the expenses.

Victoria is a woman who is well-known for her enthusiasm; her responsibility; and above all, for her dedication to her work.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals and to build a new corral.

loans.name: Luis Britaldo

texts.es:
Luis  tiene 30  años de edad, vive en casa propia en la zona rural de Pacora en una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque,  en su vivienda cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua.

Luis se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en una mototaxi que es de su propiedad. Dicha labor la desempeña en los alrededores de su localidad  Esta actividad la viene realizando hace  varios años, en los que ha ido adquiriendo experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija.

Luis tiene la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi por lo que ha recurrido Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar u prestamos de 1500 nuevos soles.  Con los que el podrá realizar las compras de los repuestos necesarios para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Luis es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y de muy buen carácter, las personas que lo conocen le tienen mucha estima, cariño y respeto
texts.en:
Luis, age 30, lives in his own house in the rural zone of Pacora.  It is a small community with approximately 100 families.  It is 30 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.  His home has electricity and water service.

Luis provides public transportation service with his own “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He does this work in the area surrounding where he lives. He has been doing this for several years. During this time he has been acquiring experience in the field and acquiring established customers.

Luis needs to perform maintenance on his taxi. That is why he has come to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 1,500 soles. With the loan he will be able to buy the replacement parts he needs in order to be able to offer his customers better service.

Luis is a hard-working father of very good character.  The people that know him hold him in high esteem, and they have affection and respect for him.

loans.use: to perform maintenance and to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Qotohuycho, perteneciente a la Provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Cirila, la socia tiene 34 años de edad;  la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 14, 12, 10 meses de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta al por mayor de café, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo en Quillabamba la selva peruana, la socia siembra y cosecha café al por mayor y los trae a Cusco para la venta, ella desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de sacos, costalillos de tela y de rafia para poder embalar su café en granos y traerlos desde Quillabamba. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sacos y bolsas para trasladar el café.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo indicado en la reunión y cumplir de manera disciplinada.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO” and is located in the town Qotohuycho which belongs to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

Cirila, 34, is the members.  She has a spouse and three children who are 14, 12 and 10 months old.  She alternates her household chores with wholesale coffee sales.  She has farmland in Quillabamba, in the Peruvian jungle, where she plants and harvests coffee that she brings to sell at wholesale prices in Cusco. She wants the loan to buy sacks, small fabric and raffia sacks, to pack the whole grains to bring to Quillabamba.  She is requesting the loan to buy sacks and bags to transport coffee.

She is committed to comply with the payment plan laid out in the meeting and to pay in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy sacks and bags to transport coffee.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad, vive con su menor hija en casa de su madre en el centro poblado menor de casa Blanca que pertenece al distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz.

Marianela se a dedicado ala venta de de productos de primera necesidad, ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual ella misma atiende. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona, diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. 

El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, contando con varios años de experiencia y buen manejo del negocio. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar más mercadería y ampliar su negocio con nuevos  productos.

Marianela es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Marianela is 36 years old, a mother and lives with her youngest daughter. They live in Marianela’s mothers’ home in a small town in Casa Blanca, district of José Leonardo Ortiz.

Marianela sells basic household products; she has a small pantry in her home that she works herself. She sells to her neighbors and customers in the area. Marianela sells various products for daily consumption like basic household goods and groceries.

The business is well accepted and Marianela has various years of experience and manages well her business. She needs a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to be able to buy more merchandize and to stock her business with new products.

Marianela is a very hardworking woman, easy going, and the people who know her hold her in high esteem and are fond of her.

loans.use: buy more merchandize and to stock her grocery store with new products.

loans.name: Mi Bankito (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mi Bankito está formado por 13 socias quienes son amigas y viven por el mismo sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y muy cordiales como nuestras socias, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias.

La Señora. Nube L. vive por el sector del Monay, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 5, 2 de edad, su priM. hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer privado, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Nube es de profesión sastre y trabaja en una fábrica cerca de su casa, allí se dedica  a  confeccionar pantalones, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En su hogar se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos como a la cría y venta de  pollos y cerdos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 1 año al cual fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para continuar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios secundarios.

En la fotografía del grupo está una foto pequeña adjunta de la Señora Gloria Susana que por motivos de fuerza mayor tubo que ausentarse y no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mi Bankito (My Little Bank) is made up of 13 members who are friends and live in the same zone of the city of Cuenca. This city is a mix of colonial and modern. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are friendly and cordial like our members who work in various activities that allow them to support their household finances and get their families ahead.

Ms. Nube L. lives in the zone of Monay. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 children who are 8, 5 and 2 years old. Her oldest daughter is studying in one of the city’s schools. Her husband is a chauffeur. Between them they have managed to construct their own home.

Nube is a professional tailor and works in a factory near their house.  There she makes pants. She works from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. At home she takes care of their children as well as raises and sells chickens and pigs.

Nube has been a member of the communal bank for a year and was invited by a friend. She will invest the money from the loan in buying chickens and pigs to continue this business,

Her goal is to complete her secondary studies. 

In the larger group photo there is a small attached photo of Mrs. Gloria Susana, who, because of extenuating circumstances, could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María  es una madre D. familia D. 63 años D. edad, vive con su esposo, no tiene hijos a cargo; todos son independientes, su casa es propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos D. agua y luz, en la parte anterior  D. su domicilio a colocado  su tienda, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope a  30 minutos del departamento D. Piura.  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola, ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

María se dedica  a la venta D. abarrotes (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, huevos, golosinas, etc.), en la cual sus  vecinos encuentran toda clase D. productos comestibles , con su negocio que tiene trata en lo posible D. brindarle a su familia  un mejor nivel D. vida.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa María trata D. adquirir un préstamo D. 1200 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda D. más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades D. cus clientes, y D. paso incrementar  sus ingresos para cubrir su crédito y sacar adelante su negocio.

María es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  responsable, trabajadora con el objetivo D. tener mayores comodidades en su casa con su esposo.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old, a mother, lives with her husband, and has no children under her care since they are all independent. Her home is her own and she has the basic services of water and electricity, in the front of the house she has a store. Her home is located in a rural area in the district Mórrope of some 30 minutes from the department of Piura. These areas are characterized by their high commercial, agricultural, cattle and tourist industries that the inhabitants participate in.

María sells groceries (milk, sugar, rice, eggs, candy, etc) her neighbors find all type of food products in her store and with her business she tries to give her family a better standard of living.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, María, tries to get a loan of 1200 nuevos soles to stock her store to buy more items to meet the needs of her customers and increase her earnings to pay the loan and make her business succeed.

María is known by her neighbors for being a responsible, hardworking woman and wishes to have more comfort in her home with her husband.

loans.use: buy more merchandize for her convenience store.

loans.name: Cuahutemoc

texts.es:
El señor Cuahutemoc es una persona muy responsable y bien trabajador, para el siempre esta primero el bienestar de la familia. Hace tiempo el compro el terreno donde actualmente vive; que con propios ahorros formo lo que ahora es su patrimonio.
 En este momento se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para pagar las escrituras de su vivienda, de tal manera tendrá todos en orden para un futuro que sus documentos en regla para que en un futuro no tenga problemas legales.
texts.en:
Cuauhtémoc is a very responsible, hard working person.  For him, his family’s wellbeing always comes first.

Some time ago he bought the property where he currently lives and with his own savings formed what is now his patrimony.  

He needs a loan to pay the fees associated with legalizing the deed to his house in order to have everything in good order so that there won’t be any legal problems in the future.

loans.use: to pay deed registration fees for his house.

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es:
María de 43 años es soltera, tiene casa propia con los servicios de agua,  luz y desagüe, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú y a unos 15 minutos de distancia de la provincia de Chiclayo.  En la cual los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

María tiene algunas tierras de cultivo que su padre le dio en herencia, en las cuales siembra tuberculos (papas y   camotes) y hortalizas (espinaca, coliflor, culantro,etc), las mismas que una vez cosecha vende ambulatoriamente en el mercado de su zona como de la ciudad de Chiclayo, como son productos que se venden rápido porque los pobladores lo consumen diariamente, lo quel e permite tener ingresos diarios para poder solventar sus necesidades.

Al observar María que su negocio va incrementando su clientela a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para  comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y así pueda tener productos de mejor calidad, permitiéndole pagar su préstamo y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Maríaes una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, siempre con la intensión de mejorar ella y su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, single and has her own home with running water, electricity and plumbing located in the district of Monsefú located some 15 minutes from the Chiclayo province. Most of the inhabitants in the area are farmers, cattle breeders and in handicrafts.

María has some plots of land that she inherited from her father where she grows tubers (potatoes and sweet potatoes) and vegetables (spinach, cauliflower, cilantro, etc.) those that she harvests she sells as a street vendor in the market in the area like the city of Chiclayo since they are sold quickly because the residents consume them daily. This allows María to have daily income to be able to meet her needs.

As María saw that her business keeps growing as do her customers, she went to get a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy some fertilizers to improve her plots of land so that she can have more quality products that will allow her to payback the loan and improve her quality of life. María is a responsible and hardworking woman with the intention of improving herself and the business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers to improve her plots of land.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Adolfo es un hombre muy trabajador que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia. El tiene mas de 8 años laborando para una empresa como operador donde se ha desempeñado como una persona honesta, trabajadora y gracias al esfuerzo que ha demostrado, ha permanecido en su empleo. La esposa de Adolfo es una mujer dedicada al hogar para atender los quehaceres de su casa, a sus hijos y esposo. Adolfo viendo la necesidad de su esposa que por circunstancias de salud necesita arreglarse la dentadura, el desea apoyar a su esposa en llevarla con un doctor especialista que le ayude con tal problema.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a very hard working man who sees to his family’s wellbeing.  He has been employed as an Operator at a firm for over 8 years.  He has been honest and hard working and thanks to the effort he’s put into it, he’s kept his job.

Adolfo’s wife is dedicated to tending to her home, her children and her husband.  Adolfo is aware that his wife needs to have some dental work done for health reasons and wants to take her to a specialist that will help her with her problem.

loans.use: to pay his wife's medical expenses.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una madre de familia de 20 años de edad, vive en casa de sus suegros, junto a su esposo y sus hijos, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, está ubicada en Callanca que forma parte del distrito de Monsefú y  a 20 minutos de Chiclayo.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona rural  agrícola, cuenta con restaurantes campestres y también se dedican a la artesanía.

Flor desde muy pequeña apredió la actividad de bordar, ya que forma parte de la cultura y costumbre de éstos pobladores, ésta labor la pone en práctica bordando manteles, sábanas, servilletas, etc., donde utiliza una infinidad de colores de hilos en su trabajo.  Los productos que borda son muy apreciados por los turistas, su trabajo demanda mucha dedicación y tiempo, pero por la calidad del producto,  lo puede ofertar a un buen precio para poder  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Se ha visto Flor en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 400 nuevos soles para comprar  material (hilos detodos loscolores ) para seguir bordando los pedidos que tiene pendiente, para que su clientela esté satisfecha con su producto y la sigan recomendando por el buen trabajo que realiza.  Al tener mayor cantidad de pedidos, le va permitir tener más ingresos para pagar su crédito y como es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora Flor quiere que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Flor is a 20 year old homemaker who lives with her in-laws, husband and children.  The house has running water and electricity and is located in Callanca in the district of Monsefú, 20 minutes from Chiclayo.  This is a rural farm area which has country-style restaurants and dedication to handicrafts.

Flor learned to embroider when she was very young since it is part of the culture and tradition of the local people.  She applies her skill to tablecloths, sheets, napkins, etc. and uses a wide array of colored thread in her work.  The products she embroiders are very popular among tourists and her work requires much dedication and time.  Because of the quality of her products she is able to command good prices so she can improve her family's quality of life.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 400 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy material (colored thread) to continue working on the orders she has pending.  She wants her customers to be satisfied with her products so they will recommend her based on the good job she does.  By inceasing order volume she will increase income to pay back the loan.  Since she is reponsible and hard-working, Flor wants her children to have the best possible opportunities in society.

loans.use: To buy ebmroidery supplies (colored thread).

loans.name: Carlos Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alejandro es un hombre muy responsable desde hace 10 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social pero este tipo de casa habitación son muy pequeñas, por lo que Carlos opto por iniciar una construcción en la parte trasera de su casa que fue con ahorros propios. En este momento se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para terminar la recamara como lo es enjarrar, pintar y poner ventanas. De esta manera el vera terminado su proyecto para ofrecer un mejor patrimonio a su futura familia ya que aun es un hombre soltero.
texts.en:
Carlos Alejandro is a very responsible man.  Ten years ago he got his government subsidized house.  However, this type of house is very small so Carlos started to add on to the back of it using his own savings.

He now needs to request a loan to finish the bedroom.  He will plaster, paint and install windows.  This way he will see his project completed and will have a better patrimony to offer his future family since he’s still single.

loans.use: to finish off a room he's building.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica P. is from Prenza Tangub City. She is 48 years old, and is married. To make a living, Monica owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Monica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, sugar, dried fish and bagoong for sale. This will be Monica’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, sugar, dried fish and bagoong for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Carmelina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo. Ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos pero uno de ellos falleció  y esto embarga de una gran tristeza a nuestra amiga que nos dice que es muy doloroso perder a un hijo, su otro hijo  aun vive con ella.

Tiene una tienda de comestibles en la cual vende de todo un poco, nos cuenta que su tienda es su refugio y en ella olvida un poco su gran tristeza por la pérdida de su querida hija, ya que allí día a día está en contacto con muchas personas de su comunidad  que le dan fuerzas y motivan para salir adelante. Dice que se levanta muy temprano junto con su esposo ya que sus clientes son muy madrugadores y ella tiene que brindarles el mejor servicio para que no se le vayan a otro lugar, tiene su tienda 13 años y le ha ido muy bien gracias a Dios.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en comprar arroz, azúcar, embutidos, aceites y  otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el banco casi desde el inicio y le gusta por el apoyo que siempre le han brindado.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante con su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Amor y Fe al Desarrollo” (Love and Faith in Development) communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural riches and its great crafts like straw hats that are renown both inside and outside the country.

We met Rosa, 45, here.  He’s married and had two children but one died which overcomes out friend with a great sadness.  She tells us that losing a child is very painful.  Her other son still lives with her.

She has a grocery store where she stocks a bit of everything.  She tells us that the store is her refuge and she can forget the sadness of losing her beloved daughter a bit while having contact there with many members of her community who give her the strength and motivation to continue forward.  She says that she rises very early with her husband because her customers tend to be real early birds and she has to be ready to provide them with the best service so that they won’t go somewhere else.  She’s had the store for 13 years and has done very well, thanks be to God.

She will use this new loan to buy rice, sugar, cured meats, oil and other basic need items.  She’s been in the communal bank since its start and likes if for the support it’s always given her.  Her goal is to continue with her life and business.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is 48 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Lapasan in Clarin municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Juliet provides repair services to local community members. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan, her second from GDMPC, and is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional repair tools to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional repair tools to provide better service.

loans.name: Perry

texts.en:
Perry O. is 54 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. He is from the village of Gata Daku in Clarin municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental province in the Mindano islands. Perry plants and harvests coconuts to sell. He has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Perry joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services.  He is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to finance labor costs for his farm’s maintenance and to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perry from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finance labor costs for his farm’s maintenance and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo. Ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esa relación tienen seis hijos,  todos son  mayores de edad e independientes y solo uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja está muy anciano.

Tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  en ella vende arroz, azúcar, granos, detergentes, carne, pollo, pescado, legumbres y el delicioso queso chonero que es delicioso y muy solicitado por su sabor. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que le encanta su tienda ya que allí además de ganarse la vida también se entretiene y está al tanto de todo lo que sucede en su  comunidad. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 30 años con su tienda y que es su vida, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su negocio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en comprar arroz, azúcar aceites y  otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus aspiraciones son gozar de buena salud, ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y continuar muchos años más en la Fundación Espoir que según ella le ha brindado mucho apoyo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Amor y Fe al Desarrollo” (Love and Faith in Development) communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural riches and its great crafts like straw hats that are renown both inside and outside the country.

We met Rosa, 69, here.  She’s married and has six children, all adult and independent; only one still lives with her.  Her husband no longer works, he’s quite aged.

She has a grocery store at home.  She sells rice, sugar, grains, detergent, meat, chicken, fish, legumes and the delicious “chonero” cheese which is very tasty and much sought after because of its flavor.  She works daily from 6am until 8pm.  She tells us that she loves her store because besides earning her living there she entertains herself and is aware of everything that’s going on in her community.  She tells us that she’s been in business for over 30 years and the store is her life.  Her son and husband help her with the business.

She will use this new loan to buy rice, sugar, oil and other basic need items.

Her wish is to enjoy good health, help her children become professionals and remain in Fundación Espoir for many more years which, according to her, has provided her with much support.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rodelio

texts.en:
Rodelio G. is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. He is from the village of Bagakay within Ozamiz City, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Rodelio operates a motor transport service. He has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rodelio joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan, his first from GDMPC, of 14,000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorbike’s engine. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike’s engine.

loans.name: Marmie

texts.en:
Marmie R. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Marmie is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marmie owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Marmie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marmie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marmie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marmie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marmie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo. Ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Bertha es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo este tiempo que lleva en el banco. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y estudian en la universidad, el menor todavía está en el colegio, todos viven aun en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, en especial ropa de niños ya que a ella le encantan los niños. Su forma  de venta es de puerta a puerta y por pedidos que les realizan sus clientes. Trabaja tres  o cuatro días por semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que es más fresco y en las tardes tiene que atender a su esposo y sus hijos. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cuando necesita.

Con su nuevo crédito va a comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y  en especial vestidos de niñas.

Sus metas son tener buena salud y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Con Amor Y Fe community bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for it's rich culture and for the skill of its artisans who, among other things, make the straw hats that are famous both in the country and out.

Sra. Bertha is a founding member of the community bank.  She is happy with the bank because it charges lower interest rates than other banks and because it has supported her business over the years.  Sra. Bertha is 43 years old and married with three children.  Her two oldest children are studying at the local university and her youngest child is still in high school.  All three children still live at home.  Her husband is a merchant. 

Sra. Bertha, too, works as a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothing, especially clothing for children.  She sells from door to door and also fills order from long-time customers.  She works three or four days a week, usually going out in the mornings because it's cooler and so she can take care of her family during the afternoons.  

Sra. Bertha will buy merchandise in Guayaquil when she has to restock.  She will buy pants, shirts, blouses and especially clothing for children.

Her goals are to stay healthy and educate her children for professional careers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie M. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 22 years old. Elmie is single. To make a living, Elmie owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Elmie has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elmie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmie is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Elmie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline D. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Evangeline is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor cost for farm maintenance. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Lorena Ramona

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lorena, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de seis años la misma que estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo, él cual se dedica a la venta de delantales, manteles, reposteros y embases plásticos mas que todo de cocina, su forma de venta es ambulante, el se desplaza hasta otras ciudades a  ofrecer sus productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, sus productos los compra en la ciudad de Guayaquil ya que allá le salen más baratos. Nos cuenta que él realiza esta actividad por más de ocho  años y que gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar delantales, manteles y productos plásticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta los créditos por los beneficios que recibe con ellos. 

Su sueño es que ha su esposo siempre le vaya bien en su negocio por su bien y él de su hija.
texts.en:
The members of the El Pedregal community bank meet every 15 days in Portoviejo, a city known for its thriving commercial zone, for its traditional festival of St. Peter and St. Paul, and for the friendliness of its people.

Sra. Lorena, 23, and her partner have a 6-year old daughter who is now in school.  Sra. Lorena's partner is a merchant and she takes care of their family.  She is applying for a loan to support the business of her partner.  He works as a street vendor, selling aprons, tablecloths, baking utensils and other kitchen supplies.  He often travels to other cities to sell her merchandise, working most days from 8:30 in the morning to 5:00 in the afternoon.  

He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil because it's less expensive to buy there.  Sra. Lorena tells us that he has operated the business for more than eight years now and that he is pleased with his progress.  

This loan will be used to buy aprons, tablecloths and plastic kitchen products.  It is Sra. Lorena's first loan.

Her hope is that her husband's business continues to thrive.

loans.use: Comprar delantales, manteles y productos plásticos.

loans.name: María Dioselina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 19, 16 y 7 años de edad, los mismos que  estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). En la actualidad ha empezado  a vender también ropa por catalogo y esto lo hace al mismo tiempo que realiza sus ventas de Avon. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todos los días domingo.  Lo que más vende son los perfumes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, lleva más de seis años que se dedica a las ventas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Su sueño es tener su casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The communal bank “El Pedregal” meets every 15 days in the El Pedregal location in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional celebrations for San Pedro (Saint Peter) and San Pablo (Saint Paul), and for the happiness of its people.  

Here we got to know Maria.  She is 38-years-old, married, and has three children from this relationship who are 19, 16, and 7-years-old.  They study in the university, high school, and elementary school.  Her husband is a businessman.  

She is a housewife and to have her own resources she works selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  Now she has begun to sell clothing as well by catalog and she does this at the same time that she makes her Avon sales.  She works four days a week; she sells her products on credit and collects payments every Sunday.  What she sells most are perfumes.  She orders products to her house.  She has worked in these sales for more than six years.

This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and all kinds of clothing.  She is the member who founded the communal bank and she likes it for the help she receives with the loans.

Her dream is to have a well-constructed house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  purchase fishing gear and equipment for her fishing business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Lucile

texts.en:
Lucile is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucile is 47 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a cellphone shop in the Philippines. Lucile requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase cellphone accessories and equipment for repairing cellphones.

Lucile has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Lucile would like to save money to expand her business and so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase cellphone accessories and equipment for repairing cell phones.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carmelita works hard to support her family. She has a recycling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of scrap for her recycling business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable materials.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda is 54 years old and widowed with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other farm supplies.

Evelinda has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed, vitamins and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vicenta Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vicenta, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor de 17 que es el  que  aun vive con ella y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo, el cual se dedica a la venta de toldos, toallas y embases plásticos, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es ambulante, él se desplaza hasta otras ciudades o por el centro de la ciudad para  ofrecer sus productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, sus productos los compra en Picoaza en un lugar que le dan a buen precio al por mayor. Nos cuenta que él lleva realizando esta actividad por casi 30  años y que gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar toldos, toallas  y productos plásticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos de alguna forma ella le colabora a su esposo.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The El Pedregal communal bank meets every 15 days in El Pedregal, which is in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. It is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the joy of its people.

This is where Fundación ESPOIR met Ms. Vicenta. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children with her husband. Three of her children are grown and the youngest is 17 years old, still lives with her, and attends high school. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who takes out loans for her husband's business. He sells awnings, towels, and plastic containers, among other things. He is an ambulant salesman, who goes out to other cities or around the center of their city to offer his products. He works every day from 8:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. He buys his products in Picoaza, where there is a place that gives him a good wholesale price. Vicenta tells Fundación ESPOIR that he has been doing this for almost 30 years and that thanks to God, he has always done well.

This loan is to buy awnings, towels, and plastic products. Vicenta has been a member of her communal bank since its inception and she enjoys it because these loans are a way to collaborate with her husband.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy awnings, towels, and plastic products

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia lives with her common-law husband with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cornelia is 54 years old.

Cornelia has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Cornelia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Romyleen

texts.en:
Romyleen is 31 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Romyleen works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc. 

Romyleen has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other grocery items.

In the future Romyleen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an abaca (natural fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business. She has been in this business for 15 years. Adelina earns additional income from livestock and her sari-sari (variety) store.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her livestock business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a frozen foods vending and food production business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy meat, spices, etc. for her food processing business.

Gina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy meat, spices etc. for meat processing business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jeniffer Pamela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jeniffer, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 5 años la misma que este año empezó el primer año de escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Ella es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo, el cual se dedica a la venta de  de carcasas y accesorios de teléfono, su forma de venta es ambulante, él se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta para ofrecer sus productos, en la actualidad nuestra amiga también se ha dedicado al mismo negocio ya que ella tres veces por semana le va a ayudar a su esposos y así venden mucho mas. El trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, sus productos los compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora que le deja a buen precio. Nos cuenta que él lleva realizando esta actividad por más de cinco años.

Este crédito es para comprar carcasas y accesorios de teléfono. Lleva 8 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para el negocio de su esposo.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The members of the El Pedregal community bank meet every 15 days in Portoviejo, a city known for its thriving commercial zone, for its festival celebrating St. Peter and St. Paul and for the friendliness of its people.

Sra. Jeniffer, 25, and her partner have a 5-year old daughter who just started at a local primary school this year.  Her partner is a merchant and she takes care of their family.  She is applying for a loan to support her partner's business.  

Her partner works as a street vendor, selling phone and phone accessories.  He travels as far as the city of Manta to find customers.  Sra. Jeniffer, too, works at the business, going out three days a week to help him so that together they can sell more than he can sell alone.  Her partner works every day from 8:30 to 5:00.  He stocks his merchandise from a distributor in Portoviejo who provides the products at a good price.

This is Sra. Jeniffer's 8th round at the community bank and she is a happy member because past loans have greatly helped her partner's business.

Sra. Jennifer's dream is to own a well-built house, very unlike the one she and her family live in now.

loans.use: to buy phone supplies for a retail business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng Y., 49, is a villager who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She sells a variety of merchandise in the mobile place. She has been running this business since 2005 and earns a daily income of around $3.75 that covers the family expenses. She is widowed and has three children, of whom one is a sewing worker and the other a blacksmith. Heng Y. is requesting a loan to build a new house since her old house is too old and is not comfortable for her and her children to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Pearl

texts.en:
Pearl is 21 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a Internet cafe business in the Philippines. Pearl requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase computer supplies for her internet cafe.

Pearl has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Pearl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase computer supplies for her internet cafe business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the village of Gaston, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Erlinda is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Ramona Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal  se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la Señora Ramona, tiene 49 años  de edad y es soltera. Ella vive en casa de una hermana en compañía de sus sobrinos que los quiere como si fueran sus propios hijos.  Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y nos cuenta que estos ocho años que lleva el banco han sido muy buenos ya que ha recibido mucha ayuda.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 13h00, nos cuenta que aprovecha las mañanas ya que tiene muchas clientes que son maestras y a ellas las encuentra en las mañanas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the El Pedregal community bank meet every 15 days in Portoviejo, a city known for its thriving commercial zone, for its festival celebrating St. Peter and St. Paul and for the friendliness of its people.

Sra. Ramona, 49, is single.  She lives with her sister and her nieces and nephews who she couldn't love more if they were her own children.  Sra. Ramona is a founding member of the community bank and she tells us that the bank has been very supportive of her business over the eight years that she's been a member.

Sra. Ramona operates a business selling all kinds of clothing.  She sells from door to door, working every day from 8:00 to 1:00.  She tells us that she works in the morning because many of her customers are teachers and they can see her more easily in the morning.  She sells her merchandise on credit and collects from her customers every fifteen days.  She buys merchandise in Guayaquil when she needs it. 

Sra. Ramona has operated the business for more than ten years and she is pleased with her progress.  She will use this loan to stock her business with pants, blouses, t-shirst and clothing for children.

Her goal is to continue the business.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Grecelda

texts.en:
Grecelda is 39 years old and has a common-law husband with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food production and sales business in the Philippines. Grecelda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Grecelda has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Grecelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. Rita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Rita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en:
Julieth C. is from the village of Luz Banzon, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Julieth is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Julieth owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas & coconuts in the local community. Julieth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Julieth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Julieth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Julieth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts & bananas.

loans.name: Vath

texts.en: Vath S., 26, has been a garment factory worker in the province of Kompong Cham since 2006, earning a monthly salary. She also often helps her husband's farming business by planting various crops for additional profit. Because the family wishes to move to a larger residence, Vath is requesting a loan of US$1100 to add to her savings to purchase a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a new wooden house.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment for her fishing business.

Asteria has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Asteria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear.

loans.name: Josiecora

texts.en:
Josiecora is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy beauty supplies for her beauty salon.

Josiecora has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Josiecora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and bamboo for her fishing business.

Josephine  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and bamboo for her fishing business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old and married with eight children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Nenita has been farming rice for three years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming activity.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: From the Prey Chor district, Mrs. Phin is a 28-year-old mother of two young children. She works in manufacturing in her village, earning an average profit of $2.5 a day.  Mrs. Phin’s husband works at the rice mill in his village, earning about $2.5 per day in order to share responsibility with Mrs. Phin in meeting daily needs. In order to eliminate the cost of motor taxis, Mrs. Phin will use her loan to buy a second motorcycle to travel to her workplace.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for traveling to her workplace.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert R. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 33 years old. Robert is single. To make a living, Robert owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green & yellow bananas in the local community. Robert has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Robert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Robert is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green & yellow bananas. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Robert from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green & yellow bananas.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a widow with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rhoda is 37 years old and both her children are in school.

Rhoda has a recycling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy recyclable materials.

Rhoda has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Rhoda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy recyclable materials.
